image.altText: Two red and white ships break through an icy body of water.

props.synopsis: The icebreakers have been invited to expand their use of Hobart as part of a push by the Tasmanian government to capitalise on China's growing interest in Antarctica.

title.children: As China expands its Antarctic operations, Tasmania is trying to lure its icebreakers back to Hobart

image.altText: Exterior photos of a youth detention centre.

props.synopsis: The lawyer who has helped win a $75 million payout to former Ashley Youth Detention Centre detainees says the fact their stories of abuse have been believed is "as important" as the monetary compensation they will receive â€” which in some cases could be up to a million dollars.

title.children: Judge approves $75m settlement for former youth detainees from Tasmania's Ashley

image.altText: University of Tasmania logo on clothing.

props.synopsis: A few years ago, the University of Tasmania proposed about 1,200 dwellings including medium-rise apartment buildings above its Sandy Bay campus. It sparked a furious response â€” but the land is back on the agenda.

title.children: A university in need of cash, a city in need of housing. Is parliament about to grant UTAS's wishes?

image.altText: A man between large rocks in a river holds on to one end of a yellow rope

props.synopsis: A rescue team faced with a terrible decision, complicated by a language barrier and unthinkable challenges, such as 13 tonnes of water per second to deal with. How did they save a man trapped for more than 20 hours in a river?

title.children: 'No one's practised amputating a leg in the middle of a river': How rescuers saved a man trapped during Franklin River adventure

image.altText: Large Aboriginal flag flying on city street with crowd in background

props.synopsis: For some Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, receiving an Australian of the Year award can be used to draw attention to important issues. But others feel unable to accept a nomination because the timing of the awards is too painful.

title.children: 'Not an easy decision': Many First Nations people are conflicted about Australian of the Year Awards

image.altText: Woman helping a man using a wheelchair into a van.

props.synopsis: When Taraidh became quadriplegic 18 months ago, it turned his family's emergency plans on their head. A new program is helping equip people like him with the tools they need to prepare.

title.children: 'It will save lives': Disaster emergency preparedness workshops offered for Tasmanians with disability in pilot project

image.altText: A woman is pushing a child on a swing, she has a child on her back and a third child is on a second swing

props.synopsis: Parents in this island community, which has no child care services, were "very excited" when an early learning trial for three-year-olds was promised by 2024. Now, with no progress made on delivering that, parents want answers.

title.children: Did you miss? ðŸ“£ On this island there's no childcare and a promised early learning initiative is behind schedule

image.altText: Matthew Richardson of Australia displays his silver medal on an Olympic podium

props.synopsis: Australia's track cycling defector Matthew Richardson has avoided a two-year ban from competition after his acrimonious decision to race for Great Britain.

title.children: 'He acted in a way which conflicted with our values': Australian cycling defector Matthew Richardson slammed, but avoids two-year ban

image.altText: A man wearing a black suit with two badges, white shirt and blue tie looks sideways

props.synopsis: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos vows to fight back after his vice-president, Sara Duterte, publicly threatened to have him assassinated if she died.

title.children: Philippine president vows to fight back after VP's assassination threat

image.altText: Indian players celebrate a wicket

props.synopsis: India's defence of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy begins in style, with the tourists recording a big win in Perth with a day to spare.

title.children: 'It wasn't meant to be': Aussies left soul-searching after 295-run thrashing at the hands of India in first Test

image.altText: A white yacht on sea

props.synopsis: At least 17 people are missing after a tourist cruise vessel sank in the Red Sea, officials in Egypt say.

title.children: More than a dozen missing after tourist yacht sinks off Egypt's coast in Red Sea

image.altText: People gather around an area covered in flames and smoke.

props.synopsis: Security officials say they expect between 9,000 and 11,000 demonstrators while Imran Khan's party claims the number will be much higher.

title.children: One killed, dozens injured in Pakistan clashes with Imran Khan supporters

image.altText: plane engine on the ground after it crashed into a house

props.synopsis: Lithuanian police confirm one person died in the crash, with the three other people on board the plane sustaining injuries.

title.children: DHL cargo plane crashes near Vilnius Airport in Lithuania

image.altText: A woman wearing a long sleeved pink and khaki top stands in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: Two ministers invoke the name of their late colleague Peta Murphy to offer contradictory views on why the government's gambling advertising restrictions have been delayed.

title.children: Gambling ad ban delays prompt fury in parliament and contradictions among ministers

image.altText: Tarnawsky speaks in the mural hall at parliament house.

props.synopsis: The chief of staff to Richard Marles is suing the federal government over claims she was forced out of the office for raising a bullying complaint.

title.children: Chief of staff to Richard Marles launches legal action over claims she was forced out of job

image.altText: A female judge in a court room.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory coroner has delivered her findings and recommendations from a landmark coronial inquiry into the domestic violence killings of four Aboriginal women in the territory. She's also announced she'll hold a second major inquiry into the issue.

title.children: NT coroner details 'extent of horror' in landmark DV inquest findings

image.altText: A portrait of RFK Jr against a black backdrop.

props.synopsis: What exactly does Robert F Kennedy Jr mean when he promises to "Make America Healthy Again"?Â And why are some public health experts so alarmed?Â

title.children: 'Never seen a darker day for public health': RFK Jr's 'Make America Healthy Again' plan is creating controversy

image.altText: Close up photo of young woman with red hair, eyebrow and nose piercings

props.synopsis: The man who allegedly helped Isla Bell's accused murderer dispose of the missing Melbourne teenager's body has been granted bail, subject to strict conditions.

title.children: Man accused of helping dispose of allegedly murdered Melbourne teen's body granted bail

image.altText: A slightly smiling short grey-haired woman surrounded by found children, two women and two men, parks behind.

props.synopsis: Eager for the memory of their mother to be more than the "unidentified" woman, Scott and Glen Morrison have come forward to honour the much-loved grandmother, friend and businesswoman.

title.children: Family of a geologist who died prospecting in the outback says mother was a 'hero'

image.altText: An oil slick on the ocean surface with a tanker in the background.

props.synopsis: Western Australia's industry watchdog alleges Santos did not operate its licensed pipeline in "a proper and workmanlike manner" to prevent the spill.

title.children: Regulator taking Santos to court after allegations 2022 oil spill killed dolphins, marine life

image.altText: Orange clouds over the Sydney skyline

props.synopsis: Parts of the state are on track to swelter through five consecutive days above 35C, with the NSW government receiving reports that the electricity grid could be under pressure.

title.children: Hot weather across the state leads to risk of blackouts, warns Australia's energy grid operator

image.altText: trevi fountain under construction in rome with temporary pool setup in front of it

props.synopsis: A total of 249 construction plans were set out for the pope's jubilee celebrations, and Rome mayor Roberto Gualtieri said the works are on track and that "all the main targets and milestones have been met".

title.children: Much of Rome remains a construction site as city prepares for pope's 2025 Jubilee

image.altText: A city scape by the sea, with grey smoke coming out of buildings

props.synopsis: Hezbollah and Israel have continued trading fire with more than 100 Lebanese killed coinciding with signs of progress in US-led ceasefire talks.

title.children: Lebanon ceasefire pending Israeli response after it carried out deadliest attack on Beirut

image.altText: A man with brown hair takes a selfie with grass and open space behind him

props.synopsis: Financial advisor Kris Ridgway's life began to unravel in early 2022 when it was discovered he was recommending unlisted shares to his clients. As Ridgway faces up to 15 years jail, his wife Kerrilyn says she's lost her past, and her future.

title.children: 'My husband of 36 years was a conman': Estranged wife of Kris Ridgway says his scams left her with a life sentence

image.altText: Blood pressure being monitored by nurse

props.synopsis: New research from Australia's leading medical institute has found treating patients with high blood pressure is costing taxpayers $1.2 billion annually.

title.children: Treatable, deadly condition costing Australian economy $1.2 billion a year

image.altText: Ariel Bombara sits with her arms crossed.

props.synopsis: Ariel Bombara, the daughter of Floreat double murderer Mark Bombara, gives an extraordinary account of living under "persistent dread" from her abusive father, and denounces the heavy burden women carry for men's violence.

title.children: 'Do you believe me now?' Daughter of Floreat killer issues call to action at domestic violence rally

image.altText: Tony Mokbel, who is handcuffed to a police officer, arrives at the Supreme Court of Victoria

props.synopsis: Four Victoria Police officers and barrister-turned-informer Nicola Gobbo acted together to "attempt to pervert the course of justice", the Court of Appeal has found.

title.children: Police, Gobbo formed 'joint criminal enterprise' to try and put Mokbel behind bars, finds court

image.altText: Two people being pulled onto NSW Police boat.

props.synopsis: Two protesters have been granted bail after paddling into the path of a Newcastle shipping channel banned to protesters. Another 150 people are also facing criminal charges.

title.children: Climate protesters granted bail after allegedly disrupting shipping channel into world's largest coal port

image.altText: Sam Hibbens wears a white collared shirt, navy suit jacket and blue stripped tie and stands with his arms folded, smiling

props.synopsis: Former Victorian Greens deputy leader Sam Hibbins was cut from a state parliament internship program following an allegation he tried to kiss a university student during his first term as an MP.

title.children: 'He tried to kiss me on the lips': Outgoing Victorian MP faces allegations from former intern

image.altText: A man holding a phone takes a selfie

props.synopsis: Armina Hayat, 19, had complained to friends about her husband, Meraj Zafar, being violent towards her in the lead up to her death in January 2022.

title.children: 'He burned the face I used to kiss': Father of aspiring doctor murdered by husband tells killer he broke a family

image.altText: A man floats on an object while watching houses in burn in the background.

props.synopsis: About 1,000 homes have been reduced to wreckage and ashes after fire ripped through a slum area of the Philippine capital Manila.

title.children: 'Everything is gone': Fire tears through Manila slum area

image.altText: An underwater photo of a fish.

props.synopsis: The fate of a rare fish is unknown after heavy rainfall washed mud and sediment from ADCO Constructions' Forest High School site into Curl Curl Creek.

title.children: Construction firm fined for pollution that may have wiped out Sydney's last climbing galaxias

image.altText: A close-up of a fire ant being held by tweezers.

props.synopsis: Experts say riverbank infestations of fire ants are exploding south of Brisbane, and there's a risk the venomous pests could spread further through flooding.

title.children: These venomous pests can float on floodwaters, and thousands of nests have been found south of Brisbane

image.altText: A composite image of Ed Sheeran and Bob Geldof.

props.synopsis: Sheeran shared his distaste for Geldof's charity project, saying if asked to participate again he would refuse.

title.children: Damaging stereotypes or saving the hungry? Bob Geldof and Ed Sheeran face off over LiveAid
